subSections.title: Readings
Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|ひゃく}}

# [[hundred]]
# a very [[many]], [[lots]], [[a lot]]
# one [[hundred]] years old, advanced [[age]]

subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text: This is the most common term for {{m|en|hundred}} in modern Japanese.

subSections.title: Idioms
Derived terms
Usage notes
subSections.text:
While ''ho'' or ''o'' is only used in compounds, ''momo'' can be used on its own.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

Archaic. Generally only found in set phrases or compounds.

subSections.title: Derived terms
Usage notes
subSections.text:
While ''momo'' can be used on its own, ''ho'' is only used in compounds, where it has lost the initial consonant and appears instead as ''o'' (see below). Generally only used in reference to multiple hundreds of things, as in terms {{m|ja|五百|tr=io||five hundred; a very many}} or {{m|ja|八百|tr=yao||eight hundred; a very many}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

Obsolete. [[supersede|Superseded]] by ''o'' (see below).

subSections.title: Etymology 4
Usage notes
subSections.text:
While ''momo'' can be used on its own, ''o'' is only used in compounds. This ''o'' was originally pronounced ''ho'' (see above). Generally only used in reference to multiple hundreds of things, as in terms {{m|ja|五百|tr=io||five hundred; a very many}} or {{m|ja|八百|tr=yao||eight hundred; a very many}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

Archaic. Generally only found in set phrases and compounds.

subSections.title: Derived terms
subSections.text:
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|二%百|ふた%お}}: two hundred
* {{ja-r|三百|みお}}: three hundred
* {{ja-r|四%百|よ%お}}: four hundred
* {{ja-r|五百|いお}}: five hundred; a very many
* {{ja-r|六百|むお}}: six hundred
{{der-mid}}
* {{ja-r|七%百|なな%お}}: seven hundred
* {{ja-r|八百|やお}}: eight hundred; a very many
* {{ja-r|九%百|ここの%お}}: nine hundred
* {{ja-r|八百%万|やお%よろず}}: eight million; a great [[multitude]], a [[countless]] large number or amount
{{der-bottom}}
